clinical_study.brief_title: Characterization of Sitting Postures in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Characterization of Sitting Postures in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to assess the intra and inter-subjects variability of the pressure measurement cartography in healthy and well and able volunteers, sitting on a rigid base during two hours.

detailed_description.textblock:
- The purpose of this study is to understand the formation of pressure sore, to improve the care of paraplegic patients.
- This pilot study is going to help to establish a model in healthy volunteers in the prevention of pressure sores.

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of intra and inter-subjects variability of the pressure measurements for the whole population included.
primary_outcome.description: Sit pressure measurements of all subjects of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between interface pressure measurements and postural data.

other_outcome.measure: Correlation between interface pressure measurements and the response to micro electrical stimulation of the buttock.
other_outcome.description: Sit pressure measurements Body composition: body fat mass, lean body mass, water body, bone mineral content etc.

intervention.description: Orthotest CE is a rigid base mapping system composed by 1024 pressure transducers uniformly distributed in a 35x35 cm surface. Orthotest CE is a product manufactured by Vista-Medical. The patient sit on the rigid base during 2 hours to record the pressure and all the data needed for the pilot study. Pressure measurement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- more or equal than 18 years old
- age between 20 and 30 years old
- affiliation to social security or similarly regime
Exclusion Criteria:
- Person with pacemaker
- Person with a history of lumbar pain, chest or/and cervical pain.
- Person with an history of lumbar, chest or/and cervical muscular disorders,
- Person with history of circulatory problems,
- Person with history of skin pathologies at the seat area,
- Protected person referred to in Articles L1121-5 to L1121-8 of the Code of Public Health
